contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2012}} {{Infobox protected area of Australia | name = Family Islands National Park | iucn_category = II | image = Australia_Locator_Map.svg | caption = | locator_x = 225 | locator_y = 51 | nearest_town_or_city = [[Tully, Queensland|Tully]] | coordinates = {{coord|17|55|33|S|146|08|07|E|type:landmark_region:AU}} | area = 8.69 km² | established = 1994 | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | managing_authorities = Queensland Parks and Wildlife Service | official_site = {{url|http://www.derm.qld.gov.au/parks/family-islands/index.html|Family Islands National Park}} }} The '''Family Islands''' are a group of continental islands lying a short distance off the coast, about mid-way between Cairns and Townsville, in [[Far North Queensland]], Australia. Most of the area has been designated as a national park. The islands were given their collective name and also English names by Captain Cook when he sailed through the area in 1770. The island group are [[continental island]]s. They were part of the mainland until roughly 8,000 years ago when the sea level rose.<ref name="nch">{{cite web |url=http://www.derm.qld.gov.au/parks/family-islands/culture.html |title=Family Islands National Park: Nature, culture and history |date=3 April 2012|publisher=Department of Environment and Resource Management |accessdate=20 August 2012 }}</ref> ==The Islands== The largest of the Family Islands, their Aboriginal names, and their position in the "family" are: * [[Dunk Island]] (Coonanglebah) – the father * Richards Island ([[Bedarra Island|Bedarra]]) – the mother * [[Wheeler Island (Queensland)|Wheeler Island]] (Toolgbar) and Coombe Island (Coomba) – the twins * Smith Island (Kurrumbah), [[Bowden Island]] (Budjoo) and [[Hudson Island]] (Coolah) – the triplets. There are also a number of smaller islands: * [[Kumboola Island|Kumboola]], which is connected to Dunk Island on particularly low tides * Mound Island (Purtaboi), which is protected as a sea bird nesting habitat * Woln Garin, a small island off Dunk Island's south east corner, known locally as "40ft Rock" * Battleship Rock (Pee-Rahm-Ah), named because of its distinctive shape when seen from the north. * [[Thorpe Island]] (Ti mana), which is privately owned with one residence. This is the only Australian island which is owned [[Fee simple|Freehold]]. ==Facilities== Camp grounds are available on Dunk, Coombe and Wheeler Islands, with permits available from Queensland Parks and Wildlife.<ref name="ci">{{cite web |url=http://www.derm.qld.gov.au/parks/family-islands/camping.html |title=Family Islands National Park: Camping information |date=3 April 2012|publisher=Department of Environment and Resource Management |accessdate=20 August 2012 }}</ref> Resorts operate on [[Dunk Island|Dunk]] and Bedarra Islands. ==See also== {{Portal|Queensland}} * [[Dunk Island]] * [[Protected areas of Queensland]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{National Parks of Queensland}} [[Category:National parks of Far North Queensland]] [[Category:Islands on the Great Barrier Reef]] [[Category:Protected areas established in 1994]] [[Category:1994 establishments in Australia]]
